result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan W. Duffy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
03/31/2016:  Date Committed modified.

Jail credit of 46 days if revoked.  Case 15CF709 dismissed/read-in.

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF600 and 15CF806

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
No contact with DH, CK, or JL.  No contact with suspected or known drug users and drug dealers.  Not to consume, use or possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Submit DNA sample.  Undergo any assessments, treatment, counseling and conditions deemed appropriate per agent.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.
